message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a pituitary adenoma which can affect the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis. Bilateral adrenalectomy is not indicated as it would result in adrenal insufficiency. Hydrocortisone is a glucocorticoid replacement therapy that is needed in case of adrenal insufficiency. Mometasone and Methotrexate are not indicated in this case.

This patient needs supplementation with glucocorticoids like hydrocortisone to ensure normal functioning of the axis. Bilateral adrenalectomy will result in the loss of the patient’s natural source of glucocorticoids, and mometasone and methotrexate are not used to treat HPA axis dysfunction.
